thread.title: Liverpool's Jordan Henderson reveals how he has grown into role of Reds skipper since taking armband
thread.title_full: Liverpool's Jordan Henderson reveals how he has grown into role of Reds skipper since taking armband

author: Paul Gorst
title: Liverpool's Jordan Henderson reveals how he has grown into role of Reds skipper since taking armband
text:
Sport Liverpool's Jordan Henderson reveals how he has grown into role of Reds skipper since taking armband The England midfielder inherited the armband at the start of last season following Steven Gerrard's retirement and has gone from strength to strength Share Henderson is enjoying an excellent season with Liverpool     
Jordan Henderson has admitted he had to grow into the role of Liverpool captain. 
The England midfielder inherited the armband at the start of last season following Steven Gerrard's retirement. 
Henderson has grown into a natural leader and he admits he was left with no other option, reports the Liverpool Echo. 
The Reds skipper met USA Women's captain Carli Lloyd for a chat this week after the American was at Anfield to witness the 1-0 win over Manchester City on New Year's Eve. 
Henderson told Carli in a chat filmed for for the club's official website: "I sort of grew into it over a short space of time. Jordan Henderson during Liverpool training (Photo: Liverpool FC/Getty Images) Steven Gerrard gives the captain's armband to Henderson (Photo: Action Images) 
"I shout now and then but not too much. Maybe on the pitch I am more vocal and then off the pitch I talk to people one-on-one a bit more and try to lead by example when I'm off the field. 
"I try to lead my life right and work as hard as I possibly can and do the best for my teammates as well. 
"So I am really enjoying it and there are a lot of good captains and leaders in the team.
